review_title: Friendly folks and worlds of opportunity
pros: Tennessee State University has amazing faculty, students, and community.
cons: Nashville traffic is challenging sometimes.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: Faculty have grants to buy new modern equipment for the labs
cons: Student assistantship is not commensurate with the high cost of living in Nashville

pros: Good life balance and work place
cons: Poor leadership at work place

pros: Students are fabulous, welcoming campus community
cons: Reimbursements take months and months. I was not reimbursed for travel for my interview until 5 months after. My contractually guaranteed moving expenses have still not been paid after 6 months of employment. Any travel must be paid up front and will increase your debt because it will spend multiple months on your credit card accruing interest before you even sniff the reimbursement.

job_title: Director of Public Service in Nashville, TN
pros: Flexible schedule, Fun employees, wonderful students, community engagement
cons: low pay and working with management was difficult

job_title: Director Of Engagement And Visibility in Nashville, TN
pros: The people are great to work with.
cons: Most positions are underpaid. People stay because of the great environment.

pros: It is very good university
cons: administration was bad in the first 3 years now is better.

pros: The job is pretty easy if you don't have other colleagues telling you what to do. My colleagues are actually amazing and we get along very well.
cons:
The administration is a disaster. Students and faculty complain all the time. They don't get anything done on time, they are always in a bad mood, they don't answer emails, they tell you one thing but do the opposite. This doesn't apply to everyone, obviously, but in general the admin has a bad reputation.
Also some of the buildings are very old, freezing cold, and with mold everywhere.

job_title: Director of Engagement in Nashville, TN
pros: The people, the students, the environment
cons: Pay varies depending on the area you're working in.

review_title: It was good while it lasted
pros: Love the mission and history of the institution.
cons: Leadership was a challenge for me.

review_title: Excellent place to work.  Excellent place to serve.
job_title: Associate Vice President in Nashville, TN
pros: Team environment, school pride, and support for professional development.
cons: Very busy place to work.

pros: Pay was standard, and work life balance was good.
cons: Leadership from the top down is horrible.

pros: Wonderful students and great colleagues
cons: Management wasn’t supportive and low salaries

pros: Good hours especially the summer
cons: Poor leadership. Staff do not care about students.

review_title: Decent environment; little support from leadership
pros: Generally I like my job... most of my co-workers are very nice and knowledgeable. The politics are horrible, and people who have no place working there are maintained because they serve a "purpose" are retained, while quality individuals are discouraged and leave due to lack of support. My direct supervisors tell me what they think I want to hear, rather than the truth, and then do the opposite of what they told me, making it impossible to trust my leadership. If my boss tells me he is supporting my in the decisions I make, and then outright lies by doing the exact opposite and throwing me under the bus for doing exactly what he said he wanted me to do, it makes for low job satisfaction. Unfortunately it seems to be the theme throughout the University.
cons:
- Salaries tend to be low across the board (staff, faculty)
- Little support from leadership, hence poor moral
- Difficulty getting people to do their jobs so that you can do yours effectively (see first two bullets)

pros: Freedom to create in this field
cons: Poor quality equipment is the main problem

pros: Good hours, good breaks in between shifts
cons: No cons very great work place

pros: My experience at Tennessee State University has been wonderful.
cons: Sometimes I will experience stress with completing assignments and projects.

pros: none that I can think of
cons: tenure not available for all

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: it's very good university to study, as for me, I learn in here to pursue my phd, and I really like the environment and people.
cons: the location not very good

review_title: Great place to work if you have  a good advisor
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: They are concerned about your well-being
cons: The pay is poor, considering that you have to have pay tuition and the rising cost of living in Nashville.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: POTUS helped me excel in numerous ways these past 3 years. I've published numerous studies, presented at conferences, and graduated with my Doctor of Physical Therapy degree.
cons: The financial aid office tends to be slow at times.

review_title: We do research here, and I can get paid while getting a degree with research assistantship

review_title: Not a good place to work.
pros: There are no pros here.
cons: They are all cons here.

job_title: Librarian III, Associate University Librarian in Nashville, TN
pros: Definitely the benefits and retirement plan.
cons: No cons really it's a great place.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: Enabling working environment, affable and professional staff
cons: Low workload to staff ratio

review_title: Its was very humbling experience alot of grow and achievements.
pros: its has the best experts thats no college has including training you have to become a great professional in the indstry work. It serves with huge success and highly recognition from staff and faculty.
cons: Not enough benefits enplus no paid vacations.

pros: Working at TSU could be a rewarding experience.  It has a rich history, excellent professors, and good students.  Being a part of the movement to advance the university and help students reach their full potential has always been a blessing.  TSU can be a great school, it has a great campus, and most are good people.
cons: The previous administration was a problem here. It was unwilling to listen to anyone else's point of view.  The new administration will need to clean house, get rid of incompenent, unqualified staff that is tarnishing the reputation of the university.  The University can be great, but without competent employees it will fail.

job_title: Graduate Research/Teaching Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: I held this position as a graduate student in the Agricultural Sciences department, so my schedule was extremely flexible fro research and specific for teaching but you had a set schedule so you knew where to be at all times. Extremely friendly environment with lots of diversity.
cons: With being a student there were no benefits and you accrued no time off, sick leave and were limited to the hours you could claim for each month regardless of how long you actually spent doing the research, but remember this is as a graduate student.

pros: Free classes, good benefits, easy access off Interstate, many paid days off to recover from being at work. Good band and pep squad. Up-to-date computer equipment and software campuswide-they did a good job keeping the latest bells and whistles on everyone's computer.
cons: Politics, favoritism, some people were not challenged when they acted inappropriately because administrators feared backlash. Inappropriate references to people's religious beliefs and proselytizing--religious messages on employee's voicemail, questions about religious beliefs during job interviews. Salary compression a huge problem--newly graduated faculty brought in at the current salary of 20-year veterans.

job_title: Summer Camp Counselor in Nashville, TN
pros:
- The campus is in the heart of Nashville which makes it ideal for traveling to and from. 
- Some of the management staff is supportive and well aware of the issues 
- HR is pretty good about getting contracts sent out to employees that is if they're done on time.
cons:
- Insuboridnates and unqualified management who only selfishly care about their needs 
- The top administration refuses to acknowledge the issues that must be addressed in order for the school to move in a positive direction. 
- HR is blamed for all problems revolving around pay, but it is the hierarchy that wrecks havoc. 
- The students are mediocre. Many of them shouldn't be in college. 
- You have to wait months before getting paid for a job you've done, and the pay is "bubblegum."

review_title: Being an Exempt Level Staff Member Can be Okay
pros: Campus community, student support/activities, overally atmosphere (outside of the office environment) is welcoming.  When someting needs to be accomplished, for the most part, the University Community bands together to accomplish this task.
cons: Management is awful!  Department Heads and/or Directors do not know about the full functions of their offices, some ignore the suggestions and opinions of others.  There is no support for advancement, and if you try to advance, you better not let anyone find out!

review_title: ~It's not the job that's bad, it's the incompetent administration~
pros:
-Great benefits available
-Bookstore and market are nice
cons:
-Understaffed
-Faculty/staff are hired but are not qualified for the positions they hold
-Some of the new VP's are bullies, this is due to being in a position they don't understand which makes some people defensive.

pros:
Providing great education is very rewarding.
The benefits package is better than most.
cons:
Each year, we are supposed to make do with less money for each department. 
There are so many interim positions that it leaves many with a sense of uncertainty about the state of the university. 
The community does not see how hard the students and faculty/staff are working. There are still a lot of prejudices that the university faces on a daily basis.

review_title: Great place to learn about astronomy, optics, control systems, and robotics.
pros: Wonderful staff members, attentive supervisors, and a flexible work load that fits in with your classes and other personal concerns. Probably one of the best part-time opportunities a college student could hope for.
cons: Temperature control doesn't really work well in many of the facilities, so my advice is to bring a sweater or a jacket if you're accustomed to room temperature.

review_title: The University is growing and trying to keep pace with growth, but the ba;;olls at a very slow pace.
pros: The landscape is beautiful and the work will be challenging.  You will meet a lot of good people.  The squirrels are a nice addition to the campus.
cons: Where is the growth. I have not seen the availability for upward mobility.  Where is the recognition of employees. Just from my perspective.

pros: everyone is so helpful and friendly ... you can discuss all your queries and doubts to anyone you want. if you want to work hard, achieve a goal and cannot spend too much... this is the place for you.
cons: housing is a bit problem for students, especially for out of state or country cuz there is no guidance for that or a place in university where such issue can be discussed.

pros: provided good experience for further growth and was able to put it on a  resume. pay was also reasonable.
cons: but there were also a few internal issues with my "team" and private investigator. my situation turned out fine but there is the potential for drama and also the constant run around when it is time to be paid dealing with the TSU bursar office.

pros: People are nice, the benefits are good, there is good autonomy, and reasonable cost of living in the Nashville area.
cons: Understaffed so you have to ask multiple times to get anything done, mediocre students, students often try to cheat, management generally incompetent, last-minute and disorganized, religious atmosphere.

job_title: Residence Life, Resident Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: Free Housing!!!!! Awesome housing opportunities. Great week training, and great way to meet other college students!
cons: Its one of those jobs where you are always working no matter what. Especially when you are trying to sleep. Night Shifts are long and boring.

pros: one has the chance to make a difference in lives that need it most.
cons: The general atmosphere is very depressing. No capacity for engaging existing talent pool. And no idea how easily the University could become the flagship public institution for Metro Nashville.

job_title: Administrative Assistant IV in Greenbrier, TN
pros: Benefits are about the only thing.
cons: Unless your a friend of upper administration, your pay isn't great. These are state positions, but TSU is lower, if not the lowest paying for these positions according to the TBR database.

pros: Lots of downtime to get homework done
cons: Having to deal with students being loud who do not listen when you tell them to quiet down

review_title: Great school to work for the faculty is very inviting.
pros: The students are great if you show them respect they will show you respect. The fellow faculty members are very helpful at times.
cons: The cycle pay can be inconvenient.

review_title: Good Place to work! Hard to advance
pros: Family environment, educational support, great culture, work space privacy and work/life balance
cons: Salary and needs to progress toward modern processes

cons: Sometimes no research funds to professors so no job opportunities

pros: Rich history of academic excellence, civic/ cultural education and athletic achievement.
cons: Big fish in a little pond syndrome. Rampant cronyism.

review_title: Basically it's good to study and work here
pros: Every body would like to help. Environment is friendly. Working pace depends on yourself.
cons: Documents process sometimes is slow. Resources here is not rich.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Nashville, TN
pros: Good work place professional relationships. Everybody cares about your career.
cons: Poor logistics especially for ordering lab supplies.

pros: Highest student pay on campus, flexible to school schedule, great co-workers and networking.
cons: Work from 4pm-11pm usually which includes weekends, no likely promotion, managing large crowds.

pros: Direct interface with the local police and working in a multi ethnic community
cons: Working hours were not helping me attend classes in certain times

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: Is a open friendly school where everybody works with out caring about the race.
cons: There is no organization in the work team.

pros: Warm, family oriented work environment.
cons: My salary was funded by a grant. Once the grant funding ended, my position ended.

pros: Flexible schedule with classes and assignment
